title: Psalm breaks horribly if line breaks are CRLF
body:
### Scenario
I am currently fiddling around a bit with [ubuntu for windows](https://ubuntu.com/tutorials/tutorial-ubuntu-on-windows#1-overview) and I thought psalm would be a great project to work on with this. I installed all composer packages and required PHP extensions and even the suggested `ext-igbinary`.

It took me a few days to realize that this was not the issue, but the fact that I checked out psalm with PHPStorm on windows and was using it in the ubuntu command line. This lead to the line breaks in the code being CRLF (aka `\r\n`) instead of only LF (aka `\n`).

To help debug this I created some examples ( ⚠️ careful, they only break if your linebreaks are CRLF, which is obviously not shown in the code below):

### How to reproduce
code:
```php
<?php

namespace Some\Weird\Space;


class A {
    /**
     * @param string|null $bla
     * @return array{
     *          0: \Some\Weird\Space\A|null,
     *          1: null
     *          }
     */
    public function doSomething($bla): array
    {
        echo '1' . (string)$bla;
        return [null, null];
    }
}

$bla = new A();
$bla->doSomething('2');
```

output:
```
Scanning files...
Analyzing files...

E

' in docblock for Some\Weird\Space\A::doSomething type 'Some\Weird\Space\null
    /**
     * @param string|null $bla
     * @return array{
     *          0: \Some\Weird\Space\A|null,
     *          1: null
     *          }
     */
    public function doSomething($bla): array


------------------------------
1 errors found
------------------------------

Checks took 1.40 seconds and used 117.811MB of memory
Psalm was able to infer types for 100% of the codebase
```

### Expected output
just leaving this here as a reference for the full bug report, and it works fine if the linebreaks are LF only:
```
Scanning files...
Analyzing files...

░

------------------------------
No errors found!
------------------------------

Checks took 1.41 seconds and used 117.818MB of memory
Psalm was able to infer types for 100% of the codebase
```

### Remarks
My guess is that this has something to do with the tokenization going wrong and I have it in the back of my mind that there was some piece of code that I stumbled upon during debugging that was just searching for `\n` and nothing else, which sounds like it could have to do with it, but I could not find it again yet.

That being said, my debugging efforts only led to this guess so far and I can not really put my finger on it as you can probably tell.

Given that nobody else seems to have stumbled upon this so far I wonder if it is even relevant, but if so, I would be happy to dig deeper and find a solution - just let me know! Thanks!

**P.S.:** I almost forgot to add. I was not looking for that problem but when I run `./psalm` on master in this configuration, it throws over 400 errors because of this problem.
